meanings.sent1: The battery is dischargeable, meaning it can be used multiple times.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the camera's battery is fully charged and dischargeable before your trip.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's dischargeable powers allowed him to shoot lightning bolts from his hands.
meanings.sent4: Her dischargeable energy lit up the room like a bright beacon.
meanings.sent5: The dischargeable fireworks illuminated the night sky with bursts of color.

meanings.definition: Able to be released or relieved from a duty or obligation.
meanings.sent1: The soldier was grateful to hear that he was dischargeable from his duties after serving for many years.
meanings.sent2: Employees with valid reasons may be dischargeable from their work responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The student felt dischargeable from the pressure of completing all her assignments on time.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed dischargeable from his shoulders as he walked out of the office.
meanings.sent5: The dischargeable burden of guilt lifted from her heart as she finally confessed the truth.
